text: [Applause]
uh hi everyone my name is Joyce I'm a
software engineer working in a team that
deploys machine learning techniques to
government sectors and today I'm going
to talk about a common problem in
machine learning known as covariant
shift so let's do some motivation first
say you are doing a speech regulation
project it might take you huge amount of
time and money to finally get a data set
that is ready to train different models
and uh luckily you manage to get a best
model that gives you the average
validation accuracy of 96% after cross
validation everybody is happy with this
and then you decide to put this model
into real life production so millions of
dollars were spent to deploy this model
into Vehicles however after one month
you got many complaints that this model
is not working so you start an
investigation and get a query
set you found the accuracy on the query
set is as low as
67% and no matter how complicated model
you have tried you always get that kind
of low accuracy so what is going on here
it turns out that the voice in the
training set only got the voice of human
however in the query set you got the
mixed voice of human and the background
Vehicles so given our model has never
listened to the voice of uh Vehicles it
is understandable that why the accuracy
on the query set is that low so this is
a very classic examp example of
covariant
shift um this is the outline of today's
talk I would first talk about what is
covariant shift why would it occur and
what consequence would it have then I
will talk about ways to detect the
covariant shift we have visualization
method and the quantitative method
lastly I will talk about two strategies
to handle covariant shift so the formal
definition of covariant shift is that
when the Distribution on the training
and query or test set do not match we
are facing the coent shift or sample
selection bias so this is apparently
against the fundamental Assumption of
supervised learning that both the
training and query set should be drawn
from the same population or
distribution so basically we have this
distribution the mismatch problem uh
look at the left hand side the green
line shows the density of training data
set and the Orange Line shows the
density of query set you can tell from
this distribution plot that they come
from the same distribution because their
density looks almost the same which is
always assumed for supervised learning
well in the right hand side you can see
the density of training and query are
completely different which means they
come from different population so we
have this assumption violation for the
supervised
learning actually coant shift is very
common in real life projects say your
training sample generated might suffer
this lack of Randomness or due to
limited time and budget you end up with
inadequate samples for instance we all
know it's very uh expensive to get
samples for medical related project
apart from that the sample you got you
get might be selected from very biased
rules say you only got samples from
Victoria State then it would be very
biased if you are going to generalize
your model to the whole Australia
because apparently the features on the
rural area will be very different from
the features on the open area in
Victoria
state so there are two major
consequences the coant shifter would
have first the model you train might
overfit on the training examples and the
predictions on the query set might be
unreliable say we have this binary
classify Pro uh classific problem um in
the left hand side we have this ground
Troth where the orange points at the
data set with label zero and the blue
points are the data set with label one
you can see the the training set mainly
located in the middle part whereas in
the query set they locate on the upper
and bottom part so our classifier would
might learn a wrong decision boundary
shown as this red dash line uh you can
see it rly classified nearly half of the
query set if the classifier got a chance
to see the points on the upper or bottom
part then it might be able to to learn
this optimal deis boundary shown as this
screen dash
line so it would be always a good
practice to detect a CO variant shift in
the first place many people might not
bother to do this and jump directly to
the machine learning part but this will
create potential risks if you are going
to apply your predictions into real life
project so here I want to talk about
three ways we got visualization
membership modeling and uncertainty
quantification so the most
straightforward way is to plot both the
training and query set together and see
if it obvious that they got different
distribution and uh you might ask me
what if I got high dimensional data
which is always the case in real life
project so I would first recommend a per
dimensional visualization if if your
features are not like hundred or a
thousands after that we would always do
a dimensionality reduction with PCA or
TSN then we can visualize dimensionality
reduced the training and query set
together on a 2d plot but bear in mind
that PCA sometimes might hide the
potential distribution mismatch apart
from that the visualization is very
subjective and open to interpretation
ation which means we need more robust
methods to tell us if we got coent
shift so we got a quantitative method
called membership modeling so the main
idea is that we apply a model to predict
the probability of a new point being a
member of the training set for example
the one class svm could classify new
data as similar or different to the
train training set say we have our our
training
observations uh here in the white points
and the one class svm would learn a
frontier shown as this red circle then
the one class svm would classify points
that are similar to the training set in
Color Purple you can see the purple
points mainly inside the circle or near
the circle
and the one class svm would also
classify the points that are different
from the training set in color yellow
you can see the yellow points located
far away from your training
observations another quantitative method
I want to talk about is uncertainty
quantification so we first fit a
probabilistic model to the training set
and with probabilistic model every
particular has uncertainty or confidence
interval associated with it so the
concept of uncertainty is that given a
new point that is similar to the
training set our model will be very
confident about the true Target value
for this new point because the model has
seen many training points share these
similar features whereas given a new
points that's is different from the
training set our model would be very
uncertain about about the true Target
value for this new point because the
features for the new Point our model has
never seen before then you can determine
the co variant shift by looking at the
uncertainty of
predictions so to better demonstrate
this idea I want to show you this
regression um example so here we got our
training observations in green points
the model would learn a regression line
shown as this green line you can see
surrounding this regression line we got
an area F in the color gray this shows
the 95% confidence interval for your uh
predictions then given a new query Point
shown there the model will give you a
prediction value shown as this red Point
apart from that the model will give you
the lower and upper bond for your
prediction you can see the bond is very
wide which indicates we have a high
uncertainty associated with this
prediction this makes sense if you take
a close look at this query point you can
see the X it got has never been seen by
our model given the training samples
mainly uh located in the middle part so
the the conclusion is that if this point
gets a low uncertainty that means this
new point is similar to the training
data set if if this new Point got a
prediction with high uncertainty that
means this new point is different from
your training data
set so after detecting the coant shift
we need to handle coant shift uh here I
want to talk about two strategies the
first one is training sample reting the
main idea is to make the distribution of
training data look like the distribution
of query data the second strategy is
active learning so it basically helped
the model gain understanding about the
query data and learn effectively so with
sample reating we first build a
classifier to classify training and
query set maybe training data got label
zero and query data got label
one so for instance we have this data
set where the training data points are
in color yellow and query sets are in
Color Purple after the classification
the classifier would learn a decision
boundary shown as this red dash line to
separate the training and query set if
you look at this plot I actually colored
the training set with the probability of
being inside the query set you can see
some points with light yellow
here light yellow here which which means
they got low probability being inside
the query set it's obvious that this
light yellow far away from the query set
right and we got some dark yellow points
in the middle they got a high
probability being inside the query set
you can see they almost mix with the
purple points
there so with this probability being
inside the quer reset for every training
sample we can re Reit our training
points in the learning process so the
idea is that initially we treat every
training Point equally but with the
presence of coant shift some training
points are more important if they are
similar to The query set well some
training points are less important if
they are far away from the training set
so the probability of being inside the
query set would be used as the weight
for reweighting the training examples so
hopefully after reting the density for
the training and query set would match
shown as the plot on the right hand
side so one thing to bear in mind that
overlap between distribution of training
and query set is essential to apply
sample reting because say if we got an
overlap shown as this green circle if
you look at their density plot this
overlap is is actually the area where
the where we have the red vertical lines
that means uh we have some knowledge
about the query data set in contrast if
the training and query set are far away
from each other then their distribution
has no cross-section then we know
nothing about the query set and your
classify might learn the weight for
every training example nearly zero then
it won't make sense to reweight your
samples in the learning
process so it would definitely eliminate
coant to shift if you can get more
samples well the problem is how can you
get more samples we all know it's
expensive to get new observations and
compared to randomly getting more
samples we should think of a better way
to get the most informative training
observations this is why I want to
introduce you the active learning
so the idea behind the active learning
is that the model will decide the next
observation to receive to most improve
the performance this allow the model to
prioritize the area it is most uncertain
about so this floww diagram shows the
process of applying Active Learning so
given the training and quer res set we
train a probabilistic model and then we
predict for the query set that then you
find the query point that is expected to
most improve your performance for
instance you might select the point
which could reduce the uncertainty for
the whole query set or you want to
select the point that could reduce the
most highest upper Bound for your
confidence interval it depends on what
kind of thing you want to achieve with
active learning then get the target
value for that most useful point you put
this point into your training cohort
then you retrain your model and rep
predict hopefully this time the
uncertainty level would reduce a lot
with this new informative training
observation so to better demonstrate how
active learning works in the real life I
want to show you a live demo so say we
want to know the number of government
employees in Australia but due to
limited budget we only have this member
in this number in Victoria State there
so you but you want to know this number
through whole Australia what we did is
that we apply a model to predict the
number of government employees for every
local government area in Australia where
the features are some demographic
features we have for every local
government area the
remember as I mentioned before this
approach would have coant shift problem
because our training observations are
only from Victoria State this is very
biased because the demographic features
in the rural area say North Australia or
West Australia would differ a lot in to
the demographic features in the Alban
area so before I show you how active
learning eliminate the variant shift I
want to show you the ground choose for
the number of government employees in
Australia so we color the map with the
quantity the yellow means High quantity
the purple means low quantity so this is
our prediction in the first round so we
only got training samples shown as these
Blue Points in Victoria State and uh we
this model predict the quantity for the
whole Australia and remember
we color this map we color the
uncertainty by the transparency of every
prediction so you can see the predictor
value are very similar for the rural
areas in New South Wales and Queensland
this makes sense because for for open
area they share very similar demographic
features well for the rural area you can
see the transparency is a lot because
because our model is not very confident
about the true quantity in the rural
area so our model tells us that you
should get the quantity in the Del one
shown as this red point there and if you
get the quantity for the doll you repr
predict you can see the differences so
the transparency disappear a lot in the
North Area after you but bear in mind
only got one observation from Del but
the uncertainty level reduced a lot in
most of the North Area this is the magic
part about Active Learning so the new
the the UN certain point it might share
same features for not only the position
we get the observation but for the areas
where they share share the same features
so compareed to get a new observation
from the new Wheels apparently get more
observation from the ja will improve
your mode a lot so we continue to the
next round so this time our model tell
us we should get sample in the Western
Australia so you can see compared to the
ground Choice our model did a great job
after getting extra three
observations so this is how active
learning could help the model learn cost
effectively
so let's compare these two strategies
for handling covariant to shift uh for
sample reating the bad thing about is
that it is achievable if we cannot get
more samples well the bad part about
that is we need overlap between the
training and quer res set apart from
that we actually gain less understanding
about the query set well for active
learning we do not need the overlap and
we can gain more understanding about the
data we work with the B thing about
about it is that it is not achievable if
we cannot get more
